purpose: The code appears to be part of a package publishing utility that collects system information and sends it to a Discord webhook. It gathers internal and external IP addresses, system details, and package metadata.
analysis: This code demonstrates a clear security risk by automatically collecting and transmitting sensitive system information including internal and external IP addresses, hostname, DNS servers, and package metadata to a hardcoded Discord webhook. This constitutes unauthorized data exfiltration without explicit user consent. The code also makes network requests to external services (ipinfo.io) and uses hardcoded credentials in the form of a webhook URL, which is a serious security vulnerability.
conclusion: High security risk due to unauthorized data collection and transmission to external services, potential data leakage, and hardcoded credentials.
